entry.title: Trauma-Informed Care
entry.content:
OVERVIEW:

This training provides a comprehensive understanding of Trauma-Informed Care. We explore the principles and practices of Trauma-Informed Care, focusing on recognising and responding to the signs and effects of trauma in individuals. Participants will learn how to create a supportive environment that promotes safety, trust, and empowerment, while developing strategies for integrating trauma-informed approaches into their daily interactions and practices.

This course can be adapted for managers and team leaders to include, Developing and implementing Trauma-Informed policies and procedures.

COURSE TO INCLUDE:

  • What is Trauma-Informed Care?
  • Key principles and practices of Trauma-Informed Care.
  • Recognising signs and symptoms of trauma.
  • Understanding the impact of trauma on physical and psychological health.
  • Strategies for creating a trauma-sensitive environment.
  • Techniques for supporting individuals with trauma histories.

entry.title: Specialist Training
entry.content:
The specialist training provided by Lantern is delivered using a psychologically informed approach. This reflects the knowledge that we are all impacted by our environment and experience, and this is closely related to how we can care for our own wellbeing.

Lantern's specialist training covers a range of topics that offer a deeper insight into sometimes difficult and challenging material. While offering education on these topics, we are also mindful of the potential affect it might have for people attending the courses. Extra care is taken by our psychotherapist trainers to offer one to one support and signposting for anyone who has been affected by issues raised.

Our specialist training sessions are five to six hours in duration and can be delivered online, on-site or in another location as part of an event. There will always be time available at the end of the session for informal discussion and personal support.

Gender Specific Support

Vicarious Trauma

entry.title: Mission Statement
entry.content:
The Lantern mission is to equip as many people as possible with tools to survive and thrive, and the opportunity to connect with themselves and others. We endeavour to meet everyone where they are at, without judgement, with empathy and unconditional regard. Our sessions will always deliver information to empower and inspire.

Giving back and working together

We are delighted to offer free, or by donation, training sessions and wellbeing workshops to companies, charities, organisations and groups, who share our values and vision for a better world. We would also love to discuss any ideas for collaborations and skill swaps.

If you would like to nominate any organisations that would benefit please get in touch: emma@lanternlife.co.uk

You will be deemed to have been made aware of, will be subject to, and will be deemed to have accepted the changes in any revised Cookie Policy by your continued use of the Site after the date such revised Cookie Policy is posted.

USE OF COOKIES

A “cookie” is a string of information which assigns you a unique identifier that we store on your computer. Your browser then provides that unique identifier to use each time you submit a query to the Site. We use cookies on the Site to, among other things, keep track of services you have used, record registration information, record your user preferences, keep you logged into the Site, facilitate purchase procedures, and track the pages you visit. Cookies help us understand how the Site is being used and improve your user experience.

TYPES OF COOKIES

The following types of cookies may be used when you visit the Site:

Our Cookies

Our cookies are “first-party cookies”, and can be either permanent or temporary. These are necessary cookies, without which the Site won't work properly or be able to provide certain features and functionalities. Some of these may be manually disabled in your browser, but may affect the functionality of the Site.

Personalise Cookies

Personalise cookies are used to recognise repeat visitors to the Site. We use these cookies to record your browsing history, the pages you have visited, and your settings and preferences each time you visit the Site.

Site Management Cookies

Site management cookies are used to maintain your identity or session on the Site so that you are not logged off unexpectedly, and any information you enter is retained from page to page. These cookies cannot be turned off individually, but you can disable all cookies in your browser.

Third-Party Cookies

Third-party cookies may be place on your computer when you visit the Site by companies that run certain services we offer. These cookies allow the third parties to gather and track certain information about you. These cookies can be manually disabled in your browser.

CONTROL OF COOKIES

Most browsers are set to accept cookies by default. However, you can remove or reject cookies in your browser’s settings. Please be aware that such action could affect the availability and functionality of the Site. For more information on how to control cookies, check your browser or device’s settings for how you can control or reject cookies.

OTHER TRACKING TECHNOLOGIES

In addition to cookies, we may use web beacons, pixel tags, and other tracking technologies on the Site to help customise the Site and improve your experience. A “web beacon” or “pixel tag” is tiny object or image embedded in a web page or email. They are used to track the number of users who have visited particular pages and viewed emails, and acquire other statistical data. They collect only a limited set of data, such as a cookie number, time and date of page or email view, and a description of the page or email on which they reside. Web beacons and pixel tags cannot be declined. However, you can limit their use by controlling the cookies that interact with them.

PRIVACY POLICY

For more information about how we use information collected by cookies and other tracking technologies, please refer to our Privacy Policy lanternlife.co.uk/privacy-policy posted on the Site. This Cookie Policy is part of and is incorporated into our Privacy Policy. By using the Site, you agree to be bound by this Cookie Policy and our Privacy Policy.

entry.title: Vicarious Trauma
entry.content:
OVERVIEW:

This training is an in-depth look at what Vicarious Trauma means and how it can impact on people in the workplace.  We learn about the signs and symptoms of Vicarious Trauma and apply this to how we can manage it as individuals, including how we advocate for ourselves in a team, how to address our work/life balance and how to apply healthy coping strategies.

COURSE TO INCLUDE:

  • What is vicarious trauma?
  • Physical and psychological affects
  • How do I know when I am affected by it?
  • What can we do to manage this as a team?
  • Personal Plan

entry.title: Gender Specific Support
entry.content:
OVERVIEW:

This bespoke training offers a unique insight into what a Gender Specific Approach is. Lantern offers the client the opportunity to learn about the benefits as well as the differences that inform the Gender Specific Approach and applies this to supporting clients as well as staff teams.

COURSE TO INCLUDE:

  • What is a Gender Specific approach?
  • Why would we potentially work in this way?
  • Trauma Informed Care

entry.title: Gaming & Social Media Dependency
entry.content:
OVERVIEW:

As our work/life balance becomes more impacted by the modern world we increasingly look for ways to escape the stresses and strains put upon us. Lantern reflects on what can happen when we develop a dependency, particularly focusing on gaming and social media. By learning about dependency, we can then introduce ways to bring the associated behaviours into our awareness and create choice.

COURSE TO INCLUDE:

  • What does dependency mean?
  • Dependency and needs fulfilment
  • What is Mindfulness and how to use it as an effective tool
  • Cycle of change
  • Overcome barriers to change – ABC technique

entry.title: Drug & Alcohol
entry.content:
OVERVIEW:

Lantern has extensive experience in the field of dependency and brings this knowledge to the workplace to offer a trauma-informed insight into the cause and effects of alcohol and drug use. Working from the ethos of a therapeutic approach we look at needs fulfilment and the effect of unmanaged alcohol and drug use on an individual’s wellbeing. We explore ways to change or maintain lifestyles, and how to reduce the impact on physical and mental health.

COURSE TO INCLUDE:

  • Substance identification and physiological impact
  • What is a trauma informed approach?
  • Needs fulfilment
  • Dependency and the workplace
  • Triggers, tips and tools
